manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: LG 27GP850-B Gaming Innovation Beyond Boundaries Built for gamers, it delivers the latest hardware, specs, ergonomics, sleek design and sensory experience. With gaming-focused features like NVIDIA G-SYNC compatibility, 1ms GTG response times, pro-level customization and fast, vivid IPS panels, you're sure to gain an added edge.
Previous page Next page 1 Nano IPS 1ms 2 IPS 1ms (GtG) 3 QHD + Nano IPS + HDR 4 165Hz (O/C 180Hz) 5 NVIDIA G-SYNC Compatible

AMD FreeSync Premium With FreeSync Premium technology, gamers can experience seamless, fluid movement in hi-resolution and fast-paced games, It virtually reduces screen tearing and stuttering. Dynamic Action Sync Dynamic Action Sync elevates your gameplay for a pro-level experience. Respond to action, opponents and every moment with minimized input lag and unbelievable performance.

Black Stabilizer Your gameplay is never in the dark. Black Stabilizer is your ally to attack or defend against enemies hiding in the shadows. It delivers a pro-level gaming experience for enhanced vision and a jump on the competition. Crosshair Accuracy is at the center of your gameplay with the Crosshair feature. Center-display crosshairs give enhanced vision and pro-level precision for increased accuracy in first-person shooter games.

Stylish Design Designed for a Comfortable Gaming Experience Customize your battle station in seconds. Raise, lower, tilt, pivot - the stand has a flexible ergonomic design to easily adapt to your environment and gaming style on a virtually borderless screen on three sides.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars High Quality & Exceptional Display
reviews.reviewText: I do quite a lot of PC gaming and I’ve had quite a lot of different monitors, and I gotta say this is my absolute favorite.The refresh fate, screen panel quality, and color quality all combine for a great visual experience. I did follow some settings from RTings to get the color just right, and it’s absolutely worth the money. The USB hub on the back is also incredibly convenient.I do see where some reviews complain about the wide angle of the legs, however I have a pretty deep desk (31”) so for me it’s really a non-issue.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Get Your Game On with the LG 27GP850-B
reviews.reviewText: As a dedicated gamer, I'm always on the lookout for the best equipment to take my gaming to the next level. That's why I was excited to get my hands on the LG 27GP850-B Ultragear Gaming Monitor, and let me tell you - it did not disappoint.One of the first things you'll notice about this monitor is its impressive size. At 27 inches, the screen is big enough to immerse you in your favorite games, while still being compact enough to fit on most desks. The QHD resolution of 2560 x 1440 provides crystal-clear images with vibrant colors, making your games look better than ever.But it's not just the size and resolution that make this monitor a standout choice for gamers. The LG 27GP850-B Ultragear Gaming Monitor features a Nano IPS display, which provides a wide color gamut and a fast 1ms response time. This means that even the fastest-moving action will look smooth and fluid on the screen, giving you a distinct advantage in competitive gaming.Another standout feature of this monitor is its variable refresh rate (VRR) technology. This technology synchronizes the refresh rate of the monitor with the frame rate of your game, which eliminates screen tearing and stuttering, giving you a seamless and immersive gaming experience.In terms of design, the LG 27GP850-B Ultragear Gaming Monitor is sleek and stylish, with a minimalist look that will fit in well with any gaming setup. It also includes a height-adjustable stand, allowing you to customize the monitor's position to your liking.Overall, I would highly recommend the LG 27GP850-B Ultragear Gaming Monitor to any serious gamer looking for a top-of-the-line monitor to take their gaming to the next level. Its impressive size, Nano IPS display, VRR technology, and sleek design make it a standout choice in the crowded gaming monitor market. So if you're ready to get your game on, this monitor is the perfect tool for the job.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fantastic display, perfect size
reviews.reviewText: Upgraded my PC and decided it should have an upgraded monitor to go with it.This is a great display for both gaming and other less graphically intensive activities. Perfect size for my setup and 2K resolution that I typically run in my games. Was looking at 4K monitors but realized I didn't want to shell out the additional cost for the PC components to run 4K resolution while gaming.I really appreciate the adaptive refresh rate abilities of this monitor, as it keeps what's on screen smooth with no flickers or tearing. I don't notice any eye fatigue during long game or work sessions.Colors are good. White is white. Black is about as black as you can get with this type of display panel. Numerous options in the on-screen menus to adjust different color settings if desired, or just use one of a few presets.The built-in USB hub was a feature I was specifically looking for in a gaming monitor. Was happy to find it in a model that didn't require a huge price premium as many others did.I also appreciate the ability to rotate between landscape and portrait orientation. There are times portrait orientation is a big help in my work.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect gaming monitor!
reviews.reviewText: I have been using this for months now and I absolutely love it. It’s the perfect size display and has beautiful colors. The refresh rate is more than enough and it’s very high quality.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Better than I expected
reviews.reviewText: I recently decided it was finally time to upgrade to the realm of high resolution gaming. I looked around on Amazon and found this LG Ultragear for on sale from around $446. It came a day early and once I plugged it in, setup the resolution and HDR, booted up a game, and I admit, I did not really see the difference between 1080P and 1440P, but after testing it on a different game, I slowly came around.ProsResolution:The detail to the game was much more intense and after doing a back to back from my old monitor to my new one, I can say for certain that there’s a bit of blur from the 1080P monitor compared to 1440P.Monitor features:I’ve never thought the idea of using an LG brand monitor as I just never associated them with PC gaming as I had only ever gotten 1 LG TV throughout my life and I’m honestly glad I decided to go with LG. The monitor easily installed into the stand and makes it easy to install other third party stands that are compatible. The menu design is pretty simplistic and easy to use. G-Sync has 3 settings within the monitor menu; off, basic, and extended. I’ve yet to figure out what extended is for but I have mine on basic and it works great, much better than my old monitor which use to flicker which was very annoying..the monitor has an refresh rate overlock setting within the menu settings which was surprising as I assumed I would overlock through Nvidia control panel. I’ve not touched that yet as I’m perfectly happy with the refresh rate at 165Hz compared to my old monitor at 144Hz. Now one of the main reasons I decided to go with this LG brand the fast response time. I’ve never had a monitor with a 1ms response time and with this monitor you can set between off, normal, faster, and fastest. I couldn’t tell you exactly if I see a difference so far in the response time, but I am glad to have a monitor that as that specific feature built in along with the settings in the menu to adjust. The last two main settings is the the black stabilizer and the crosshair. I haven’t had a need to change the stabilizer nor have I really tried out the crosshair feature yet, but I may play with it if I get on an FPS in the future.ConsNow, the only main problem I have with this monitor and the only reason I am giving it a 4 out of 5 star instead of 5 out of 5 is the dang monitor stand! The monitor stand is huge! I do not like how big it is and wish they had designed something better as the stand bumps up against my computer which sits on the back of my desk and barely gives me room to set the keyboard in front. I do understand that this monitor is a bit on the heavier side, but they should have designed it in a much more compact design. The very back of the stand like awkwardly sticks out and just wasn’t a very good design in my opinion. The only other thing that I’d have to not like about it is my old monitor was a curved monitor and now coming back to a solid flat screen makes me really wish this was also a curved monitor.Now, this is bar far the best monitors I’ve ever had but I am just coming from a 1080P monitor so their could be a much better monitor out there, but I think with this monitor on sale it was beyond worth it. I have always appreciated LG for their TV’s and now I can honestly say I can appreciate them for their computer monitors as well. The only thing that is in dear need of improvement is the stand. If it had not been for the stand, this would have been the most perfect monitor and I’d be completely in love with it. Other than that it is a beautiful monitor and works perfectly as I need it for. I’d recommend getting this while it’s on sale and also think about getting a different monitor stand to replace the default one. I don’t think you’ll be disappointed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent picture quality
reviews.reviewText: Expensive but excellent picture quality! Was really stunned how good the IPS panel looks! Worked excellent with my Xbox series x 120hz!

En RTINGS.com la clasifican como el mejor monitor 1440p/27"/120-144/IPS junto a la M27Q-P (pero está última teniendo un gamma de colores inferior y no contar con G-SYNC aunque tiene mejor negros)Si te cuesta comparar monitores con otros para ver cuál es mejor o cuál recomiendan te diría que te quedes con este, llevo meses comparando información, precios, críticas, daños, defectos y recomendaciones sobre monitores con estás características y la conclucion fue que este tiene mejores resultados que cualquier otro aparte de contar con G-SYNC (todo un plus para tarjetas de videos de NVIDIA) si tuviera que buscarle algo negativo diría que como todo IPS tiene fugas de luz si la pantalla queda inactiva pero no se nota si hay vídeo o juegas en parte oscuras por lo que solo lo verás si desconectas el monitor del CPU y que peca al reflejar el entorno (nada de unas cortinas no solucionen) fuera de eso es excelente sus colores asombran y la calidad es increíble!También incluye cable HDMI y DispleyPort 1.4 por lo que te ahorras unos cuantos pesosEso sí recomiendo esperar que este en oferta, yo lo conseguí en 7,400 ya con envío a Mex, por lo que podrían tenerlo como una estimación.Hay mejores pantallas pero por precios ridículos de 15k o más por lo que recomiendo igualmente ir a RTINGS.com y asegurarte de cuál monitor cumple tus necesidades y capacidades.

I have spent almost 8 months searching for a gaming monitor 144hz and above, 1440p IPS. I've been in local PC stores to check out a few like the Dell S2721DGF and Gigabyte G27 among other MSI and ASUS TIF ones in this price range. This LG 27GP850-B was a bit more expensive even while on sale BUT worst every single penny. I went ahead and purchased two of them for dual monitor setup.This monitor can get a little too bright, there is ZERO ghosting that I've seen, no backlight bleed (yes.. NONE) and the 165hz or 180hz OC is noticeable. This nano IPS technology is awesome. IThe only thing I don't like about this monitor is how heavy and bulky the stand is and there are better stands out there but I purchased a monitor arm to mount both onto it and it's perfect. Also when powering down the monitor in a multi-monitor setup, sometimes the windows get pushed into 1 monitor when you turn them back on but can be resolved via the NVIDIA control panel although I do not have this issue happen often.This monitor is GREAT for TV Shows/Movies and Office work, which another main reason I wanted a 1440p.Do NOT hesitate to purchase this.. trust me I have gone through countless reviews and I'm glad I went with an LF panel compared to an AU Optronics or Sharp.

Respecto al producto muy muy satisfecho, la verdad es que es el primer monitor que compro y esta increible me encanto, el tamaño me parecio perfecto, el unico detalle es respecto al envio de Amazon, he realizado varias compras y ninguna me ha llegado el dia que promete, siempre tiene retraso.

reviews.reviewTitle: FANTASTIC, usb pass through is spotty though.
reviews.reviewText: I used to be a BenQ TN panel fanboy because of CSGO and the higher refresh rates they had in comparison to IPS panels back in the day, plus IPS was expensive and image wasn't as important as frames.This IPS, 165hz panel is amazing. I did a quick side by side, I have an older i7-4790k paired with a 980ssc GPU, and two identical newer PCs running 5600x's and 3070's and the image quality at the same settings for Elden Ring was mind boggling.Played faster frame FPS games and it was comparable to my BenQ 144hz.In the end, high frames, not a bad price, image quality is fantastic.The only negative is that I use the monitor usb pass through for my wireless keyboard and wireless mouse.Whenever I use the usb cable to charge my keyboard, it shorts the usb slot on the monitor.Had to get LG customer service to help me remedy the issue, by turning off the monitor and cycling it by unplugging the monitor from the surge protector.That's been the only negative so far.
Es una satisfacción jugar y hacer lo que sea en este monitor, calidad de imagen espectacular en su panel nano IPS, si estás pensando en jugar a 2K esta es la mejor opción.
